messages.message: Hello, I am working on an RFP for a US Federal Govt customer.  One of their requirements is that all IT products and services are *Internet Protocol IPV6 compliant.*  Does Instabase meet this requirement?  cc: @Matt Macnak @Halyna O'Sullivan
@jack any insight on this one? Also another question for the RFP question bank. :slightly_smiling_face:
although I'm not easily finding a department of Treasury policy for ipv6, i presume they want to ensure Instabase can operate on an IPV6-only network @Heymian
Here's the RFP that describes the requirement (pg6) - they have it listed as compliant IAW NIST Pub 500-267B Rev 1

@Matt Macnak I agree with @jack. NIST  500-267B r1 talks about the ability to operate on IPv6 only environment.

@Heymian, does Instabase work on IPv6 only environment? This would be applicable to our application and the underlying infrastructure.
@Matt Macnak resurfacing an old topic - I believe IRS is one of the few agencies that require US only personnel
I don’t actually know, I was just routing the original question. :) the production eng would probably know best. cc @shaunak to see who to ask.
@Shubham Oli @Cody Boggs would probably be the best people to answer this…

This should, I think, be something we can handle at the mesh level (ie: envoy), as all IB traffic will eventually be proxied through there anyway. We should be able to avoid any code updates for ipv6, I hope
Correct.  So I’m guessing the answer is we are IPV6 and IPV4 compliant…
Anyway to know here?  We will have to submit this in a written RFP response & will likely be tested against our ability to do this if/when we are selected
